name: Easy Swiss Steak
ingredients: {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt, divided'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'beef round steak, cut 1-inch thick'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) can', 'name': 'diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'minced green bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'onion powder'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}

name: Instant Pot Swiss Steak
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'bottom round steak, 1 inch thick and trimmed of fat'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'avocado oil, divided, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, chopped (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'carrot, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped celery'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Merlot wine'}, {'quantity': '2 ¾', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'canned chopped Italian-style tomatoes in juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'oregano'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'paprika'}
steps: Dry steak well with paper towels and cut into four 4-inch pieces. Season with salt and black pepper.. Place flour into a shallow bowl. Dredge steak in flour, shaking off excess.. Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot) and select Sauté function. Heat 1 tablespoon avocado oil in the pot. Working in batches, cook steak in hot oil until browned, about 2 minutes per side. Transfer browned steak to a warm plate and set aside.. Add remaining 1 tablespoon avocado oil to the pot. Cook and stir bell pepper, onion, carrot, and celery in hot oil until onion is soft and translucent, 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Pour in wine to deglaze the pot. Mix in tomatoes, Worcestershire sauce, 1 teaspoon salt, oregano, and paprika. Return steak to the pot and push down into tomato mixture.. Close and lock the lid. Select manual pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set the timer for 30 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.. Allow pressure to release naturally according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Carefully open the valve to release remaining pressure, about 5 minutes more. Unlock and remove the lid.

name: Slow Cooker Swiss Steak
ingredients: {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'round steak, cut into small pieces'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'stalks', 'name': 'celery, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'carrots, shredded'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) cans', 'name': 'diced tomatoes with juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'brown sugar, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}
steps: Mix together flour, salt, and pepper in a shallow bowl. Dredge steak pieces in flour mixture to lightly coat.. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir celery, onion, and carrots in hot oil until tender, about 5 minutes. Add coated steak pieces; cook and stir until lightly browned, about 5 minutes more.. Transfer steak-vegetable mixture to the slow cooker. Stir in tomatoes with juice, brown sugar, and Worcestershire sauce.. Cover and cook on Low until steak is very tender, 8 to 10 hours.

name: Easy and Quick Swiss Steak
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'paprika to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'beef cube steaks'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, sliced into rings'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red bell pepper, sliced into rings'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onions, sliced into rings'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) cans', 'name': 'crushed tomatoes'}
steps: Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat. In a bowl, mix the flour, salt and pepper, and paprika. Dredge the steaks in the flour mixture, and place in the skillet. Brown steaks on both sides, and remove from heat.. In a slow cooker, alternate layers of steak, green bell pepper, red bell pepper, onion, and tomatoes.. Cover, and cook 6 to 8 hours on Low, until steaks are very tender.

name: Swiss Steak
ingredients: {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(2 pound)', 'name': 'beef round steak, 1 inch thick'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'vegetable shortening'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) can', 'name': 'diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, minced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Mix flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper together in a bowl. Sprinkle half the flour mixture on one side of round steak pieces; pound steak until coating is absorbed. Flip steak and coat with remaining flour mixture; pound steak until coating is absorbed. Cut steak into 6 pieces.. Melt shortening in a large skillet over medium heat; place steak pieces in the hot shortening. Cook until browned, 7 to 10 minutes per side. Cover and simmer until tender, about 1 hour, adding water as needed.. Turn steak pieces over and add tomatoes, onion, and green bell pepper to the skillet. Season with salt and black pepper. Simmer until vegetables are tender, about 30 more minutes.

name: My Mom's Swiss Steak
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(1/2 pound)', 'name': 'beef sirloin tip steaks'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(1 small) chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 ounce) can', 'name': 'diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'sliced fresh mushrooms (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'stalk', 'name': 'celery, chopped (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped green bell pepper (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'bay leaf'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'cornstarch (Optional)'}
steps: Heat oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Place steaks into the pot one at a time, quickly browning on each side. Remove steaks, and set aside. Add the onion to the pot, and cook over medium-low heat until wilted, about 3 minutes. Return the steaks to the pot, and add the tomatoes, mushrooms, celery and green pepper. Season with oregano and add the bay leaf.. Cover the pot, and cook over medium-low heat for about 1 1/2 hours, or until meat is fork tender. If you wish to thicken the gravy, remove the meat to a plate. Stir together the cornstarch and water; stir into the pan juices. Let simmer for about 2 minutes to thicken. Return the beef to the pot.

name: Grandma's Slow Cooker Swiss Steak
ingredients: {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'beef round steak, cut into strips'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) can', 'name': 'cream of mushroom soup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) can', 'name': 'Cheddar cheese soup'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped green bell pepper, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'browning sauce (such as Kitchen Bouquet®), or to taste'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Place flour into a bowl. Dredge round steak strips in flour to coat.. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat; brown strips of round steak in the hot oil, 7 to 8 minutes per side.. Transfer beef strips to a slow cooker. Add cream of mushroom soup, Cheddar cheese soup, onion, green bell pepper, garlic, Worcestershire sauce, and browning sauce; stir. Season mixture with salt and black pepper.. Cook on High and cook for 4 hours.

name: Granny's Swiss Steak
ingredients: {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(4 ounce)', 'name': 'cube steaks'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'medium onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'stalk', 'name': 'celery, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(6 ounce) can', 'name': 'mushroom stems and pieces, undrained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(1 ounce) envelope', 'name': 'dry onion soup mix'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'tomato juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'ketchup'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Dredge the cube steaks in a mixture of flour, salt and pepper, and brown them in the hot oil.. Arrange steaks in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle the green pepper, onion, celery, mushrooms, oregano, and onion soup mix over the steaks. Stir together the tomato juice and ketchup; pour over everything in the dish.. Bake for about 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until the meat is cooked through, and the sauce is thickened.
